page.title: 13Religious Buildings
page.content: In our area we discovered seven religious buildings.Five of these buildings were Methodist churches.One was a church of England church and one was the Salvation Army Headquarters.The Methodist churches were St.Saviours (a metal church),a chapel at Mount Pleasant(built in 1856 and added to in 1903).This was a red brick building with stained glass windows.There was a Methodist chapel at Newchapel built in 1868 in red brick.We also discovered a Methodist church at Harriseahead and Trinity Methodist church at Whitehill. The one church of England church was at Newchapel.This is a large building with a grave-yard and many services.The Salvation Army Headquarters was found in Heathcote Street,Kidsgrove.
